edu.kennesaw.cs4850.database

Class DBView

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.kennesaw.cs4850.database.DBView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IView
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ClaimView, CoveredItemView, PolicyView, RegisteredUserView, StatisticsView, TestView, TransView, UserProfileView

    public abstract class DBView
extends java.lang.Object
implements IView
    All views should extend off this abstract class. A view class will represent each table in the database. Each table chosen for the database will require it's own DBView object and TableView record.
    Author:
    Paul TODO Better Exception catching.

      • Select

        public DBView.RetCode Select(int nFields)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Select(int)

        Select statement based on the loaded data in the buffer record of the view.
        Specified by:
        Select in interface IView
        Parameters:
        nFields - The first subset of fields the view object will query the database for. 0 for full table. Generally this should encompass the primary key(s) of the view for query.
        Returns:
        The return code from the database of the statement.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • Select

        public DBView.RetCode Select(int nFields,
                    short sortField,
                    long sortOption)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Select(int, short, long)

        Select statement based on the loaded data in the buffer record of the view. This method includes extra options for the select statement.
        Specified by:
        Select in interface IView
        Parameters:
        nFields - The first subset of fields the view object will query the database for. 0 for full table.
        sortField - The field number the view needs to sort by.
        sortOption - The long option value the view needs to sort as. ASC / DESC
        Returns:
        The return code from the database of the statement.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        See Also:
        IView.Select(int)
